results.title: A Place to belong
results.creator_credit: Brian McKenzie, Daniel Scharf and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The old inner city suburb of Port Melbourne has been the traditional home for generations of working people whose community is bound by ties of class, church, sport and family. But the cohesion of the neighbourhood is threatened by the pressures of modernisation and an influx of young professionals. Filmmaker, Brian McKenzie, lets the people of “Port” tell their own stories in this affectionate portrait of a community who have always felt they “belonged” but increasingly find their children are moving away to other suburbs in the struggle for affordable housing.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian McKenzie, Daniel Scharf and Film Australia

results.title: A Place to live
results.creator_credit: Irving Lerner and Documentary Film Productions
results.brief_description: Philadelphia was originally built as a city of fine homes and buildings, but just as the city and its industries grew, so did the areas of dilapidated housing. Life was a struggle for existence for those unfortunates in the abysmal slums. However with moves under way for urban renewal, new housing will arise where the ruins were. The life a mother leads with her young son and daughter in the slums with their hope for something better in the future is the story line.

results.title: A Place for everything
results.creator_credit: Eric M Nilsson, National Film Board of Canada and Svenska filminstitutet
results.brief_description: Eric Nilsson examines the attitudes of Swedish young people, and others critical of the well-ordered society. The established institutions are considered to be inflexible, and lacking in dynamism. A plea is made for independence, imagination, and more discussion of existing conditions.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eric M Nilsson, National Film Board of Canada and Svenska filminstitutet

results.title: A Place to live: building in Maine
results.creator_credit: Fred James and Lumen Bel Productions
results.brief_description: This film shows how Pat and Patsy Hennim of Maine, U.S., adapt different building theories to build their own home in the woods, minimising on costs and maximising on living conditions. In turn they teach their ideas to a group of students.

results.title: A Piece of cake = Cest pas chinois
results.creator_credit: Jacques Bobet, Gilles Gascon, Pierre Heberrt and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The effortless style of the champion gymnast seems a piece of cake. Made without commentary, this film begins with eager young people going through their exercises in a school gymnasium and concludes with an exhibition of faultless gymnastics at the 1973 China-Canada competitions.

results.title: A Place to land
results.creator_credit: Ivern Hendrickson, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A review of the great occasions in aviation history in Australia, followed by a report on the planning, construction and opening of the new international air terminals at Sydney’s Kingsford-Smith Airport and Tullamarine, Victoria.

results.title: A Pathological anxiety
results.creator_credit: Robert Anderson and Robert Anderson Associates
results.brief_description: A presentation of psychoneurotic conditions. Examines the effect of mental disorder on behaviour, using as an illustration the case history of an office worker whose efforts to suppress his hostility result in a sense of terror and panic which prevents him from leading a normal life. Filmed at Montreal General Hospital with Dr A. H. Marcus and Dr Nathan B. Epstein.
